availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Brown (Owen County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff)

body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Frances Brown. Father of Taber Brown, George Brown, James W. Brown, Charles S. Brown, John S. Brown, Emma Brown, and Thomas Brown. Laborer in Own County in 1850. Farmer in Owen County in 1860. Sheriff of Owen County from 1863 to 1866.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 34; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 31; "An Act for the Benefit of James M. Brown, late Sheriff of Owen, and his sureties," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky (Frankfort, Ky.: Kentucky Yeoman Office, John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1868), 218-19; KYR-0001-029-0554.
